content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. Disc golf is a sport in which players throw discs at a target. Atticus is investigating whether the weight of the disc used to play disc golf affects the accuracy of the throw. He obtained <math alttext="15" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> standard discs weighing <math alttext="175" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>175</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> grams each and <math alttext="15" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> lightweight discs weighing <math alttext="150" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>150</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> grams each. A player who is good at the game stood <math alttext="40" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> yards from a target and threw each disc in random order. Atticus assessed the accuracy of each throw by measuring the distance, in feet, from where the disc landed to the target. The results and summary statistics are shown in the following table. disc weight than with the other? topic.text: 7.8: Setting Up a Test for the Difference of Two Population Means

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
